alert.note: Alert for Bailey; Cochran (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 02 at 1:50PM CDT until June 02 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHERN BAILEY AND NORTHWESTERN COCHRAN COUNTIES... At 150 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated most rainfall was moving east out of the warned area, however heavy rain is still occurring south and southwest of Morton. Up to 2.5 inches of rain have fallen to the northwest of Morton. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 inch is possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Morton, Needmore, Maple, Enochs, Muleshoe Wildlife Refuge, Lehman and Bledsoe. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
